answers.answer: It's possible.  30 years is still young, but that doesn't really matter for diabetes; I know of plenty of kids and teenagers that have it.  Do you have a family history of diabetes?  From what I know, that's a huge factor.  As much as it's bothering you, I think you should get your blood sugar re-tested.  If it's not diabetes, talk with your doctor and see if you can go from there.

question: Hi, I recently realize eating very less carb and sugar helps ease my 6 month old symptoms.Symptoms such as:- Chills- Chills/burning sensation at start from the feet in the morning, then spreads later to all over the body.- mild pain on lymph nodes, all lymph node areas- low tolerance to heat and cold- growling stomach- hair fallI have this pain everyday and as I was getting little better, but with just a few 6 cookie sweets and realize my symptoms would flare up.I don't feel thirsty or tired or thirsty though. but the chills specialy from my feet and hairfall makes me think, maybe I have diabetes? am i being silly?had a sugar test maybe 9 months ago and it was fine. and I am just 30 years old.
title: Can EBV symptoms be similar to diabetes symptoms too?
